sentences.sContent: She was paid a $100,000 advance for her next two novels.
sentences.sCn: 她得到了其接下来的两本小说的10万美元的预付款。

sentences.sContent: In an exercise designed to be as real as possible, they simulated an advance on enemy positions.
sentences.sCn: 在一次设计得尽可能逼真的演习中，他们模拟了一次向敌方阵地的前进。

sentences.sContent: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.sCn: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

sentences.sContent: Our understanding of human genetics has advanced considerably.
sentences.sCn: 我们对人类遗传学的了解有了很大进展。

synos.tran: 发展；前进；增长；[会计]预付款
提出；预付；使……前进；将……提前

phrases.pCn: 随着…的增加；随着(时间)的推移
与时俱进；与时代发展同步伐
军队前卫，先头部队；先锋派

words.tran: 先进的；高级的；晚期的；年老的
前进者；相位超前补偿器，进相机
前进；增加；上涨（advance的过去式和过去分词形式）

trans.tranCn: 预付款；(常指军事行动中的) 前进
trans.tranOther: An advance is money lent or paid to someone before they would normally receive it.

trans.tranCn: 前进，推进〔尤指士兵〕；进展
trans.tranOther: to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers
